meanings.definition: To engage in a physical struggle or fight, typically involving grappling and wrestling.
meanings.sent1: The siblings decided to wrassle playfully in the living room.
meanings.sent2: The wrestlers will wrassle in the ring for the championship title.
meanings.sent3: After a long day at work, they would wrassle over who gets the last slice of pizza.
meanings.sent4: The two teams will wrassle fiercely for victory on the field.
meanings.sent5: The children love to wrassle in the backyard, laughing and having fun.

meanings.definition: A physical struggle or fight, typically involving grappling and wrestling.
meanings.sent1: The wrassle between the two competitors was intense and exciting to watch.
meanings.sent2: The crowd cheered loudly during the intense wrassle between the wrestlers.
meanings.sent3: The playful wrassle between the puppies brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: The wrassle for the ball in the soccer match was fierce and competitive.
meanings.sent5: The siblings' wrassle for the remote control ended in laughter and hugs.
